metadata.Title: CVE-2021-25219 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In BIND 9.3.0 -> 9.11.35, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.21, and versions 9.9.3-S1 ->9.11.35-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.21-S1 of BIND Supported Preview Edition,as well as release versions 9.17.0 -> 9.17.18 of the BIND 9.17 developmentbranch, exploitation of broken authoritative servers using a flaw inresponse processing can cause degradation in BIND resolver performance. Theway the lame cache is currently designed makes it possible for its internaldata structures to grow almost infinitely, which may cause significantdelays in client query processing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9').
